sage.texture

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.texture.Texture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Texture2D

    public abstract class Texture
extends java.lang.Object
    Texture is an abstract base class defining a texture object to be used to display an image on a piece of geometry. All attributes required for texture mapping are contained within this class. This includes mipmapping if desired, magnification and minification filter options, applyMode options and correction options. Default values are as follows:
    • minification filter: NearestNeighborNoMipMaps;
    • magnification filter: NearestNeighbor;
    • wrap: EdgeClamp on S,T and R;
    • applyMode: Modulate;
    • environment: none.

    Texture is intended to be subclassed for specification of various concrete texture types (for example, 2D textures, cube-mapped textures, etc.)

    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine.
    See Also:
    Texture2D

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Texture.ApplyMode
      ApplyMode specifies how texels are applied (combined with the current pixel value).
      static class  Texture.CombinerFunctionAlpha 
      static class  Texture.CombinerFunctionRGB
      Specifies the way in which the texture combiner unit will combine its incoming arguments.
      static class  Texture.CombinerOperandAlpha 
      static class  Texture.CombinerOperandRGB 
      static class  Texture.CombinerScale 
      static class  Texture.CombinerSource
      Specifies what the texture unit will choose as its incoming source argument.
      static class  Texture.DepthTextureCompareFunc
      The shadowing texture compare function
      static class  Texture.DepthTextureCompareMode
      The shadowing texture compare mode
      static class  Texture.DepthTextureMode
      The type of depth texture translation to output
      static class  Texture.EnvironmentMapMode
      EnvironmentMapMode specifies the algorithm to be used for automatic texture coordinate generation.
      static class  Texture.MagnificationFilter
      MagnificationFilter specifies the different magnification filtering operations which can be applied by a Texture.
      static class  Texture.MinificationFilter
      MinificationFilter specifies the different minification filtering operations which can be applied by a Texture.
      static class  Texture.RenderToTextureType
      When doing RenderToTexture operations with this texture, this value indicates what content to render into this texture.
      static class  Texture.TextureType
      TextureType defines the different types of textures which are supported.
      static class  Texture.WrapAxis
      WrapAxis specifies the axis on which wrapping occurs.
      static class  Texture.WrapMode
      WrapMode specifies the different wrapping modes which can be applied by a Texture.

      • getTextureId

        public int getTextureId()
        getTextureId() returns the texture id of this texture. This id is required to be unique to any other texture objects running in the same JVM. However, no guarantees are made that it will be unique, and as such, the user is responsible for this.
        Returns:
        the id of the texture.

      • setTextureId

        public void setTextureId(int textureId)
        setTextureId() sets the texture id for this texture. Zero means no id is set.
        Parameters:
        textureId - - the texture id of this texture.

      • getAnisotropicFilterPercent

        public float getAnisotropicFilterPercent()
        Returns:
        the anisotropic filtering level for this texture as a percentage in the range (0.0 - 1.0)

      • setAnisotropicFilterPercent

        public void setAnisotropicFilterPercent(float percent)
        Sets the anisotropic filtering level for this texture. Input parameter values are clamped to the range 0..1 before the value is set.
        Parameters:
        percent - the anisotropic filtering level for this texture as a percentage (0.0 - 1.0)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Returns an indication of whether this Texture equals the specified Texture. Equality is defined by comparing a number of texture attributes including:
        • textureId
        • image (the Image object associated with the Texture)
        • anisotropic filtering percentage
        • applyMode mode
        • combine functions and operations
        • environment map mode
        • magnification and minification filters
        • blend mode
        All of the above attributes must be equal for the Textures to be considered equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • createSimpleClone

        public abstract Texture createSimpleClone()

      • createSimpleClone

        public Texture createSimpleClone(Texture rVal)
        Retrieve a basic clone of this Texture (ie, clone everything but the image data, which is shared). The cloned fields are assigned to the Texture specified by the parameter (which must not be null); the specified (updated) Texture object is also returned as the function return value.
        Returns:
        a Texture which is a clone of this Texture
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input argument is null
